contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> |Name = Zvezda po imeni Solntse |Type = studio |Artist = [[Kino (band)|Kino]] |Cover = Zvezda po imeni Solntse (Kino album) cover art.png |Released = 1989 |Genre = [[Post-Punk]] |Length = 39:05 |Label = Moroz Records |Producer = |Last album = ''[[Gruppa krovi]]''<br>(1988) |This album = '''''Zvezda po imeni Solntse'''''<br>(1989) |Next album = ''[[Chyorny albom]]''<br>(1990) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r688125|pure_url=yes}}</ref> }} '''''Zvezda po imeni Solntse''''' ({{lang-ru|Звезда по имени Солнце}}, meaning "''The star called Sun''") is an album of the Soviet rock band [[Kino (band)|Kino]], released in 1989. It is notable for its mostly personal struggle-oriented lyrics and thoughtful, sad, lonely or sometimes sinister atmosphere. The cover art most likely depicts an obscured star. ==Trivia== The album cover did not exist until the album was re-released in 1996. ==Track listing== # "Песня без слов" (A Song Without Words) — 5:06 # [[Zvezda po imeni Solntse (song)|"Звезда по имени Солнце" (The Star Called Sun)]] — 3:45 # "Невесёлая песня" (Unhappy Song) — 4:18 # "Сказка" (A Fairy Tale) — 5:58 # "Место для шага вперёд" (Place for a Step Forward) — 3:39 # "Пачка сигарет" (Pack of Cigarettes) — 4:28 # "Стук" (A Knock) — 3:50 # "Печаль" (Grief) — 5:32 # "Апрель" (April) — 4:40 The song "[[So Yesterday]]" by [[Hilary Duff]] bears resemblance to "Pachka sigaret", ==Personnel== *[[Victor Tsoi]] – Vocals, Guitar *[[Yuri Kasparyan]] – Lead Guitar *Igor Tikhomirov – Bass Guitar *Georgiy Guryanov – Yamaha RX-5 ==References== <references/> {{1980s-rock-album-stub}} {{Kino (band)}} [[Category:1989 albums]] [[Category:Kino albums]] [[Category:Russian-language albums]]
